title: Pumpkin painting becomes new hallowe'en trend as safety conscious parents eschew knives and naked flames
text:
Ever since the 19th Century, carved up pumpkins have lit up the streets of Britain on Hallowe'en.

But a new health and safety movement online inspired by celebrities and artists has seen households put their knives away - in favour of paint brushes.

The new trend comes on the back of charities warning that carving spooky designs is an accident waiting to happen when in the hands of children.

“Halloween has become so popular but obviously you’re not going to let your little ones loose with a carving knife,” artist and mother Kate Elgood told the Telegraph.

Her interest in coming up with intricate designs was peaked by her five-year-old son, Max. “It evolved really from wanting to be creative with my little one on Halloween but not wanting to give him any sort of dangerous tools.”
